plants.name: Rhododendron ponticum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub native to southern Europe and Asia, featuring large clusters of vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers. It thrives in woodland and mountainous areas and is prized for its showy spring blooms.
plants.funFact: Rhododendron ponticum is the ancestral species from which many garden rhododendrons were bred.

plants.name: Acacia pycnantha

plants.funFact: The golden wattleâ€™s vivid yellow flowers symbolize unity and resilience in Australia.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A hardy perennial wildflower native to western North America, known for its tall spikes packed with colorful pea-like flowers. It flourishes in meadows and along roadsides in late spring and early summer.
plants.funFact: Lupines improve soil fertility by fixing nitrogen, benefiting neighboring plants.

plants.name: Magnolia Ã— soulangeana
plants.description: A popular hybrid magnolia cultivated worldwide for its large, showy flowers with a unique cup shape. It blooms spectacularly in late spring, heralding the end of the season.
plants.funFact: Magnolias are among the oldest flowering plants, dating back over 95 million years.
